Sorry I'm just to uptight for that.  I've had a
struggle for close to a decade now arguing that I had
a right to be called by my middle name (Kyle) instead
of my first name (Robert) by the other students.  It
went something like this:

"My name is Kyle."
"No your name is Robert."
"My name is Kyle."
"No your name is Robert."
"My name is Kyle."

You get the idea.

--- Legendarynemasis@... wrote:
> <PRE>If your only claim to fame is that you have a
> supposed above average 
> intelligence, then that is really sad. using your
> intelligence as something 
> to brag about is really shallow in itself and if you
> brag about it offline 
> its no wonder that you ar so unpopular. You should
> try to lighten up and play 
> with jokes when their made instead of complaining
> about it. Hey I believe I 
> have an above average intelligence, but then again I
> have a good social life 
> because I have fun messing around with people and
> cracking jokes, as well as 
> doing the unexpected.
>
